Package main.core.scheduler

Class Scheduler

java.lang.Object
main.core.scheduler.Scheduler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Scheduler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
This class is an implementation of the Scheduler subsystem. The Scheduler provides a means for the Floor and Elevator subsystems to communicate through a buffer. TODO: We need a channel for the Elevator subsystem to talk to the Scheduler and receive the next instruction. We need a channel for the Floor subsystem to push events to the Scheduler. We need a channel for the Elevator subsystem to receive events from the Scheduler. We need a channel for the Elevator subsystem to send a reply to the Scheduler. We need a channel for the Floor subsystem to retrieve a reply from the Scheduler.
Author:
Tony Zeidan, Evan Lloyd, Shaopeng Liu, Leenesh Kumar, YouHeng Zhou, Dominic Motora

  • Constructor Details

    • Scheduler

      public Scheduler​(boolean floorComm, SchedulerController controller)
      Default constructor for instances of Scheduler. Initializes a new Scheduler ready to have an event pushed to it.
      Parameters:
      floorComm - Whether this Scheduler instance connects to the floor or not
      controller - The controller to connect this instance to views (may be null)

  • Method Details

    • setController

      public void setController​(SchedulerController controller)
      Manually set the controller at any given time.
      Parameters:
      controller - The controller to link

      public static void updateViews​(java.lang.String logText)
      Updates any views linked to the controller (if any).
      Parameters:
      logText - The log to show

    • calcDist

      private static int calcDist​(int currentFloor, int destFloor)
      Function for calculating the distance between the current floor and a destination floor.
      Parameters:
      currentFloor - The current floor of the elevator
      destFloor - The destination floor of the elevator
      Returns:
      The distance from the current floor

    • hasReached

      private void hasReached​(int elevatorID)
      Checks if an elevator has reached either destination and updates the appropriate queues.
      Parameters:
      elevatorID - The elevator to check

    • run

      public void run()
      When an object implementing interface Runnable is used to create a thread, starting the thread causes the object's run method to be called in that separately executing thread.

      The general contract of the method run is that it may take any action whatsoever.

      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      See Also:
      Thread.run()

    • schedule

      private static void schedule()
      Wrapper for scheduling. The function is synchronized just in case both threads try to access at the same time.

    • scheduleAll

      public static java.util.Map<ElevatorStatusObj,​java.util.List<EventObj>> scheduleAll​(java.util.List<EventObj> eventQueue, ElevatorStatusObj[] elevatorList, java.util.List<EventObj>[] schedEvents)
      Schedule all events in an event queue (maybe).
      Parameters:
      eventQueue - The queue of events to schedule
      elevatorList - The list of possible elevators to schedule
      schedEvents - The scheduled events for each elevator
      Returns:
      A map of elevators and the events that were scheduled to them

    • scheduleOne

      public static ElevatorStatusObj scheduleOne​(EventObj evt, ElevatorStatusObj[] elevatorList)
      Schedules one event for an elevator. It only changes the destinations.
      Parameters:
      evt - The event in question
      elevatorList - The list of possible elevators to schedule
      Returns:
      The scheduled elevator object or null

    • whoToSchedule

      public static int whoToSchedule​(EventObj evt, ElevatorStatusObj[] elevatorList)
      Determines what elevator should be scheduled for the given task.
      Parameters:
      evt - The event to schedule
      elevatorList - The list of elevators to check
      Returns:
      The index of the elevator to schedule or -1

    • getTypeOfEventCurrentlyHandling

      public static java.lang.String getTypeOfEventCurrentlyHandling​(ElevatorStatusObj esm)
      Based on the first destination that the elevator currently is going to, we want to know if this elevator is going up or down
      Parameters:
      esm - The status of a particular elevator
      Returns:
      What type of event the elevator is currently handling

    • sortQueue

      private static java.util.Queue<java.lang.Integer> sortQueue​(java.util.Queue<java.lang.Integer> queue, boolean isMovingDown)
      Sort destination queue and remove duplications.
      Parameters:
      queue - The queue to sort
      isMovingDown - Whether the elevator is moving down or not (up otherwise)
      Returns:
      The sorted queue

      Returns:

    • putBackToEvtQueue

      private boolean putBackToEvtQueue​(int floor, int elevatorID)
      will put the event starting from "floor", that are original in scheduledQueue, we find it based on "floor" and put it back to evtQueue.
      Parameters:
      floor - The floor to check events on

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main executable for Scheduler. Makes two threads that control the flow of different channels.
      Parameters:
      args - Not used
